pageContext.claim: “[Democrats] don't even want to know who they are. These are people coming into our country with criminal records. We have murderers coming in. We have drug lords coming in. We have gangs coming in. And we're stopping them.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a prime example of the president's hyperbole. Many migrants are travelling to the U.S.-Mexico border to avoid gang violence in Central America. And while every large group has some bad apples, in this case, many are are families and unaccompanied minors — not hardened criminals. For example, in Fiscal 2018, Border Patrol agents arrested 808 undocumented migrants who were affiliated with a gang, out of just over 400,000 total apprehensions.
